title: Epitaph for Euskia
support: A marble plaque, approximately square in form, intact on left and upper edges, but irregular on right and broken along the lower edge towards the right hand side. The plaque had plaster on both front and rear when found, from later re-use as a tomb cover.

handNote.lettering: Use of lunate epsilon and sigma, cursive omega, alpha frequently with oblique crossbar descending left, and some ligatures.

provenanceFound._: Found by Orsi in the 'Cappella di Eusebio' in the southern region of the Catacomb of S.Giovanni, on 22 June 1894. Now on display in sector F of the Archaeological Museum.

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo Museo Archaeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi.

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Paolo Orsi
museum.description: An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
